title: Dataproc - Manage a cluster
abstract:
# Dataproc - Manage a cluster
This page explains how to update and delete an existing Dataproc cluster.
content:
## Update a cluster
You can update a cluster by issuing a Dataproc API [clusters.patch](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.regions.clusters/patch) request, running a [gcloud dataproc clusters update](/sdk/gcloud/reference/dataproc/clusters/update) command in a local terminal window or in [Cloud Shell](https://console.cloud.google.com/?cloudshell=true) , or by editing cluster parameters from the Configuration tab of the Cluster details page for the cluster in the [Google Cloud console](https://console.cloud.google.com/dataproc/clusters) .
The following cluster parameters can be updated:
- the number of standard worker nodes in a cluster—see [Scaling clusters](/dataproc/docs/concepts/scaling-clusters) 
- the number of secondary worker nodes in a cluster— see [Preemptible VMs](/dataproc/docs/concepts/preemptible-vms) 
- whether to use [graceful decommissioning](/dataproc/docs/concepts/configuring-clusters/scaling-clusters#graceful_decommissioning) to control shutting down a worker after its jobs are completed
- adding or deleting cluster [labels](/dataproc/docs/concepts/labels) ## Delete a cluster
You can delete a cluster via a Dataproc API [clusters.delete](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.regions.clusters/delete) HTTP or programmatic request, using the Google Cloud CLI [gcloud](/sdk/gcloud/reference/dataproc/clusters/delete) command-line tool locally in a terminal window or in [Cloud Shell](https://console.cloud.google.com/?cloudshell=true) , or from the [Google Cloud console](https://console.cloud.google.com/dataproc/clusters) .
**Deletion is permanent:** Once deleted, clusters cannot be restored. You can, however, quickly create new Dataproc clusters as you need them.
To delete a Dataproc cluster, use the gcloud CLI [gcloud dataproc clusters delete](/sdk/gcloud/reference/dataproc/clusters/delete) command locally in a terminal window or in [Cloud Shell](https://console.cloud.google.com/?cloudshell=true) .
```
gcloud dataproc clusters delete cluster-name \
    --region=region
```Use the Dataproc [clusters.delete](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.regions.clusters/delete) API to delete a cluster.Open the Dataproc [Clusters](https://console.cloud.google.com/dataproc/clusters) page in the Google Cloud console. Select the cluster by checking the box to the left of the cluster name, then Click **Delete** to delete the cluster.
